messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1158
messages.messageBody:
<<YES! Our windows are either too small or too big. We have 5.0 b/c we
were
afraid to move on to 6.0 after all we heard. So maybe it isn't the
computers
fault?

NICKI~>>

The opinions seems to be the same with all of those I've asked. I've
looked to see if Microsoft has offered a fix for the problem on their web
site but have found nothing so far.

Kris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1158
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/23/01 3:33:07 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/23/01 3:33:07 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< On the plus side, having been married for 18 years, I can appreciate the
unswerving devotion, AND the reluctance to change. <g> >>

Good point. It is a wonder my dh hasn't turned me in yet. Boy have I
changed since we started up.
LOL

NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1158
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/23/01 3:33:07 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/23/01 3:33:07 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< This happened to me recently, for the first time, my computer is almost 2
years old. When I asked my "geek" friends they said it's a "Windows
glitch" and it's been cropping up for a lot of folks in the last few
weeks. I had to make all sorts of adjustments and ever since the window
sizes have been too big. I probably should format the hard drive and
reinstall everything but it's a big job.

Kris >>

YES! Our windows are either too small or too big. We have 5.0 b/c we were
afraid to move on to 6.0 after all we heard. So maybe it isn't the computers
fault?

NICKI~
